definition: to print/to publish/publication/periodical/to peel with a knife/to carve/to amend
Newsweek magazine/also written 新聞周刊|新闻周刊

pinyin: Jian3 shi4 fang2 wu4 zhou1 kan1

sentences.english: That's true.And more Chinese step on the cover of "Times".
sentences.chinese: 沒錯，而且越來越多的中國人登上了時代週刊封面。

sentences.english: Ad pages have declined even more at Fortune and BusinessWeek.
sentences.chinese: 《財富》和《商業週刊》的廣告頁數下降更多。

sentences.english: Likewise, Sussman reads his newsweekly cover-to-cover every week.
sentences.chinese: 蘇斯曼同樣是每週都從頭到尾地閱讀新聞週刊。

sentences.english: Women’s weekly magazines tend to rely utterly on news-stand sales.
sentences.chinese: 婦女週刊趨向於全部依靠報攤的銷售額。

sentences.english: Time's 2004 Person of the Year was U.S. President George W. Bush.
sentences.chinese: 《時代》週刊2004年年度人物是美國總統布希。

sentences.english: Is it any surprise that Publisher's Weekly didn't like it?
sentences.chinese: 《出版人週刊》惡評此書，難得不令人驚奇嗎？

sentences.english: He also is a deputy managing editor of Time magazine, part of Time Warner Inc.
sentences.chinese: 他還是《時代》週刊雜誌的副執行總編。

sentences.english: Fang Xuanchang is the science editor of China News Weekly.
sentences.chinese: 方玄昌是《中國新聞週刊》的科學編輯。

sentences.english: The road of the success of Newsweekly rests with establishing brand and authoritativeness.
sentences.chinese: 新聞週刊的成功之道在於樹立品牌和權威。

sentences.english: Sunday's New Weekly, a well-known magazine didn't think so.
sentences.chinese: 週日新週刊，很受歡迎的一本雜誌不這麼認爲。

sentences.english: That’s the question taken up by Richard Haass in Newsweek.
sentences.chinese: 這是理查德哈斯在新聞週刊提出的問題。

sentences.english: blares the cover of the latest issue of Time magazine.
sentences.chinese: 幾個字高調出現在《時間》週刊的封面上。

sentences.english: The trial involved, publisher of the New York Weekly Journal.
sentences.chinese: 這些努力包括，紐約週刊的發行人，曾格。

sentences.english: This article originally appeared in the November 15, 2010 issue of TIME Asia.
sentences.chinese: 本文將在11月15日的《時代週刊》亞洲版上刊登。

sentences.english: Eric is in a towering rage and plans to sue that weekly.
sentences.chinese: 被爆料上酒店，孫耀威氣不過，打算控告週刊。

sentences.english: Some of Newsweek's predictions were spot on.
sentences.chinese: 新聞週刊的很多預測都說中了。

definition: serialized/published as a serial (in a newspaper)
photobook (loanword from Japanese), generally sexy portraits of an actress or model
to interview (a particular person or on a particular topic)/special interview/special report based on such an interview
to start publishing/to found a journal
